Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory66.jpg'}
{3: 'The son of an Administrative Officer, the Chief of his year, the one who had it all.'}
{3: "Geniuses' existence does not bother many people, but their downfalls are undoubtedly the most captivating gossip."}

{3: 'Due to using M.I.N.D. connections so intensely to the point of self-harm, he suffered incurable mental damages that disqualified him from forever being a commandant, and he instead volunteered to be a Construct.'}
{3: '—Everyone will hear about this story one way or the other, even without actively searching for it.'}
{3: 'F.O.S. Military Command College is meant to cultivate commandants that can command Constructs. Instead, he has ended up as a chess piece to be commanded.'}
{3: 'Although his specialized Inver-Device means that he does not have to be bonded to a commandant, just being a Construct is enough to cast Chrome in a narrative he cannot alter.'}
{3: 'To allow a Construct on a stage to speak as an alumnus...'}
{3: 'To some people, this is as offensive as a subordinate ordering his superiors around.'}
{3: 'Even when this Construct was once a Chief of F.O.S.'}
{3: 'That is all in the past now.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory146.png'}
{2: 'Should we pause?', 3: '16'}
{3: 'You halt the game for some reason.'}
{3: 'Chrome stops his move.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chrome', 3: "Not a bad idea. It wouldn't have been proper if we keep playing when our minds are filled with thoughts other than chess.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "I'm not in the right mood to play, anyway. After all, playing chess... is one of the few things left that relax me.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Do you enjoy it?'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Enjoyment was not a factor when I first learned it. As a Smith, I had to master everything in every field.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Especially when my father would play with me once in a while.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I lost the first few games, however, and it greatly disappointed him.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'To gain his approval, I practiced frantically after school.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Unexpectedly... I started to appreciate the joy of chess as I practiced with the AI.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'With just 64 squares, it contains possibilities that a person cannot fathom even with a lifetime.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'It takes so much time just to come up with a tactic and a countermove, but that time never feels wasted.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: "So it became a personal love eventually, and I've been playing ever since.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'You practiced with an AI?', 3: '32'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'Is that what caught your attention?', 4: '1'}
{3: "Remembering the past, Chrome's gaze slightly shifts downward."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chrome', 3: "I wasn't exactly sociable when I was studying here.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'No classmate would play with me.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Before he can answer—'}
{2: "I'm so sorry about that.", 3: '41'}
{2: "I'm so sorry that they missed the chance to play with such a great player.", 3: '43'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: '...Is that so?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'As you said...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Chrome', 3: 'If we were from the same year, and you were sitting in front of me...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Perhaps we would become great friends.', 3: '47'}
{3: 'His lips tighten as he considers the possibility.'}
{3: 'You are surprised that something you just threw out can have Chrome lost in thought for so long.'}
{3: 'After a while, he comes to a conclusion and replies solemnly—'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I think... like you said, I think we would.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'But there is no "if" in real life.'}
{3: 'You both know these are just empty words, unmanifested.'}
{3: 'Thus your conversation comes to an end.'}
{2: "Hey, seeing that it's a rare open day on the campus...", 3: '58'}
{2: 'You want to take a walk outside?', 3: '59'}
{3: 'The holographic projection turns off, and Chrome stands up from his seat.'}
{3: 'He steps in front of you, his hand reaching out as his body slightly bows.'}
{3: 'A perfect, impeccable gesture of invitation that carries with it respect and an aura that does not accept refusal.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Chrome', 3: 'I should be the one asking.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Says Chrome, gently, with a twinkle in his eyes.'}
